BABCOCK  
  
  
   (xxvi) BOWEN requires two (2) 'A' level passes in Government and 
any one of Economics, Geography, Mathematics or History.  
(xxvii) ODUDUWA accepts NCE with merit passes in relevant 
subjects.  
(xxviii) FED-DUTSINMA requires two (2) 'A' level passes in Political 
Science/Government/History and any relevant Social Science 
or Arts subject or Diploma in Personnel or Administration 
with lower credit.  
(xxix) PLASU accepts  
a) degree in any programme provided the candidate meets  
UTME requirements  
b) HND minimum of lower credit in relevant programme, with  
UTME requirements,  
c) ND minimum of lower credit in relevant programme, with 
UTME requirements.  
d) IJMB minimum of seven (7) points with passes in relevant 
subjects, plus UTME requirements.  
e) PLASU does not accept university diplomas and other 
diplomas not accredited by the relevant accrediting bodies.  
  
UTME  
(i) ABUAD, GOUU, OOU, DELSU, CALABAR, OAU, LASU, and EKSU 
require ‘O’ level credit pass in Mathematics. EKSU also 
requires another Social Science subject apart from 
Government.  
(ii) OAU and CALABAR require five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes in 
English Language, Mathematics, Government and any two (2) 
from Economics, Geography, Literature in English, Christian 
Religious Studies/Islamic Studies, History, Civic Education, 
Yoruba, ICT/Physics/Chemistry/Biology/Agricultural Science.  
(iii) IBADAN requires five (5) 'O' level cre dit passes in 
Government/History, English Language and three (3) other 
subjects with at least ‘O’ level pass in Mathematics.  
(iv) CALABAR requires two (2) Social Science subjects including 
Government.  Does not accept History in lieu of Government.  
(v) DELSU and UNN require ‘O’ level credit pass in Government 
and any 2 other subjects with at least ‘O’ level pass in 
Mathematics. Does not accept History in lieu of Government.  
(vi) EBSU requires ‘O’ level credit pass in Mathematics and two
